text_pisuk: אֱדַיִן רְחוּם בְּעֵל-טְעֵם, וְשִׁמְשַׁי סָפְרָא, וּשְׁאָר, כְּנָוָתְהוֹן--דִּינָיֵא וַאֲפַרְסַתְכָיֵא טַרְפְּלָיֵא אֲפָרְסָיֵא, ארכוי (אַרְכְּוָיֵא) בָבְלָיֵא שׁוּשַׁנְכָיֵא, דהוא (דֶּהָיֵא), עֵלְמָיֵא. | then wrote Rehum the commander, and Shimshai the scribe, and the rest of their companions; the Dinites, and the Apharesattechites, the Tarpelites, the Apharesites, the Archevites, the Babylonians, the Shushanchites, the Dehites, the Elamites, | וַיְהִי כַּאֲשֶׁר-שָׁמְעוּ אוֹיְבֵינוּ, כִּי-נוֹדַע לָנוּ, וַיָּפֶר הָאֱלֹהִים, אֶת-עֲצָתָם; ונשוב (וַנָּשָׁב) כֻּלָּנוּ אֶל-הַחוֹמָה, אִישׁ אֶל-מְלַאכְתּוֹ. | And it came to pass, when our enemies heard that it was known unto us, and God had brought their counsel to nought, that we returned all of us to the wall, every one unto his work.

text_he: ושאר אמיא די הגלי אסנפר רבא ויקירא והותב המו בקריה די שמרין--ושאר עבר-נהרה וכענת | and the rest of the nations whom the great and noble Asenappar brought over and set in the city of Samaria and the rest that are in the country beyond the River--'And now-- | ויהי מן-היום הוא חצי נערי עשים במלאכה וחצים מחזיקים והרמחים המגנים והקשתות והשרינים והשרים--אחרי כל-בית יהודה | And it came to pass from that time forth that half of my servants wrought in the work and half of them held the spears the shields and the bows and the coats of mail and the rulers were behind all the house of Judah
text_en: and the rest of the nations whom the great and noble Asenappar brought over, and set in the city of Samaria, and the rest that are in the country beyond the River:--'And now--
text_pisuk: וּשְׁאָר אֻמַּיָּא, דִּי הַגְלִי אָסְנַפַּר רַבָּא וְיַקִּירָא, וְהוֹתֵב הִמּוֹ, בְּקִרְיָה דִּי שָׁמְרָיִן--וּשְׁאָר עֲבַר-נַהֲרָה, וּכְעֶנֶת. | and the rest of the nations whom the great and noble Asenappar brought over, and set in the city of Samaria, and the rest that are in the country beyond the River:--'And now-- | וַיְהִי מִן-הַיּוֹם הַהוּא, חֲצִי נְעָרַי עֹשִׂים בַּמְּלָאכָה, וְחֶצְיָם מַחֲזִיקִים וְהָרְמָחִים הַמָּגִנִּים, וְהַקְּשָׁתוֹת וְהַשִּׁרְיֹנִים; וְהַשָּׂרִים--אַחֲרֵי, כָּל-בֵּית יְהוּדָה. | And it came to pass from that time forth, that half of my servants wrought in the work, and half of them held the spears, the shields, and the bows, and the coats of mail; and the rulers were behind all the house of Judah.

text_he: דנה פרשגן אגרתא די שלחו עלוהי על-ארתחשתא מלכא--עבדיך (עבדך) אנש עבר-נהרה וכענת | this is the copy of the letter that they sent unto him even unto Artaxerxes the king--thy servants the men beyond the River--and now | הבונים בחומה והנשאים בסבל עמשים באחת ידו עשה במלאכה ואחת מחזקת השלח | They that builded the wall and they that bore burdens laded themselves every one with one of his hands wrought in the work and with the other held his weapon
text_en: this is the copy of the letter that they sent unto him, even unto Artaxerxes the king--thy servants the men beyond the River--and now
text_pisuk: דְּנָה, פַּרְשֶׁגֶן אִגַּרְתָּא, דִּי שְׁלַחוּ עֲלוֹהִי, עַל-אַרְתַּחְשַׁשְׂתְּא מַלְכָּא--עבדיך (עַבְדָךְ) אֱנָשׁ עֲבַר-נַהֲרָה, וּכְעֶנֶת. | this is the copy of the letter that they sent unto him, even unto Artaxerxes the king--thy servants the men beyond the River--and now | הַבּוֹנִים בַּחוֹמָה וְהַנֹּשְׂאִים בַּסֶּבֶל, עֹמְשִׂים; בְּאַחַת יָדוֹ עֹשֶׂה בַמְּלָאכָה, וְאַחַת מַחֲזֶקֶת הַשָּׁלַח. | They that builded the wall and they that bore burdens laded themselves, every one with one of his hands wrought in the work, and with the other held his weapon;

text_he: ידיע להוא למלכא די יהודיא די סלקו מן-לותך עלינא אתו לירושלם קריתא מרדתא ובאישתא בנין ושורי אשכלו (ושוריא שכלו) ואשיא יחיטו | be it known unto the king that the Jews that came up from thee are come to us unto Jerusalem they are building the rebellious and the bad city and have finished the walls and are digging out the foundations | והבונים--איש חרבו אסורים על-מתניו ובונים והתוקע בשופר אצלי | and the builders every one had his sword girded by his side and so builded And he that sounded the horn was by me
text_en: be it known unto the king, that the Jews that came up from thee are come to us unto Jerusalem; they are building the rebellious and the bad city, and have finished the walls, and are digging out the foundations.
text_pisuk: יְדִיעַ, לֶהֱוֵא לְמַלְכָּא, דִּי יְהוּדָיֵא דִּי סְלִקוּ מִן-לְוָתָךְ, עֲלֶינָא אֲתוֹ לִירוּשְׁלֶם; קִרְיְתָא מָרָדְתָּא וּבִאישְׁתָּא, בָּנַיִן, ושורי אשכללו (וְשׁוּרַיָּא שַׁכְלִלוּ), וְאֻשַּׁיָּא יַחִיטוּ. | be it known unto the king, that the Jews that came up from thee are come to us unto Jerusalem; they are building the rebellious and the bad city, and have finished the walls, and are digging out the foundations. | וְהַבּוֹנִים--אִישׁ חַרְבּוֹ אֲסוּרִים עַל-מָתְנָיו, וּבוֹנִים; וְהַתּוֹקֵעַ בַּשּׁוֹפָר, אֶצְלִי. | and the builders, every one had his sword girded by his side, and so builded. And he that sounded the horn was by me.

text_he: כען ידיע להוא למלכא די הן קריתא דך תבנא ושוריא ישתכלון--מנדה-בלו והלך לא ינתנון ואפתם מלכים תהנזק | Be it known now unto the king that if this city be builded and the walls finished they will not pay tribute impost or toll and so thou wilt endamage the revenue of the kings | ואמר אל-החרים ואל-הסגנים ואל-יתר העם--המלאכה הרבה ורחבה ואנחנו נפרדים על-החומה רחוקים איש מאחיו | And I said unto the nobles and to the rulers and to the rest of the people 'The work is great and large and we are separated upon the wall one far from another
text_en: Be it known now unto the king, that, if this city be builded, and the walls finished, they will not pay tribute, impost, or toll, and so thou wilt endamage the revenue of the kings.
text_pisuk: כְּעַן, יְדִיעַ לֶהֱוֵא לְמַלְכָּא, דִּי הֵן קִרְיְתָא דָךְ תִּתְבְּנֵא, וְשׁוּרַיָּא יִשְׁתַּכְלְלוּן--מִנְדָּה-בְלוֹ וַהֲלָךְ לָא יִנְתְּנוּן, וְאַפְּתֹם מַלְכִים תְּהַנְזִק. | Be it known now unto the king, that, if this city be builded, and the walls finished, they will not pay tribute, impost, or toll, and so thou wilt endamage the revenue of the kings. | וָאֹמַר אֶל-הַחֹרִים וְאֶל-הַסְּגָנִים, וְאֶל-יֶתֶר הָעָם--הַמְּלָאכָה הַרְבֵּה, וּרְחָבָה; וַאֲנַחְנוּ, נִפְרָדִים עַל-הַחוֹמָה, רְחוֹקִים, אִישׁ מֵאָחִיו. | And I said unto the nobles, and to the rulers and to the rest of the people: 'The work is great and large, and we are separated upon the wall, one far from another;

text_he: כען כל-קבל די-מלח היכלא מלחנא וערות מלכא לא אריך-לנא למחזא על-דנה--שלחנא והודענא למלכא | Now because we eat the salt of the palace and it is not meet for us to see the king's dishonour therefore have we sent and announced to the king | במקום אשר תשמעו את-קול השופר שמה תקבצו אלינו אלהינו ילחם לנו | in what place soever ye hear the sound of the horn resort ye thither unto us our God will fight for us'
text_en: Now because we eat the salt of the palace, and it is not meet for us to see the king's dishonour, therefore have we sent and announced to the king,
text_pisuk: כְּעַן, כָּל-קֳבֵל דִּי-מְלַח הֵיכְלָא מְלַחְנָא, וְעַרְוַת מַלְכָּא, לָא אֲרִיךְ-לַנָא לְמֶחֱזֵא; עַל-דְּנָה--שְׁלַחְנָא, וְהוֹדַעְנָא לְמַלְכָּא. | Now because we eat the salt of the palace, and it is not meet for us to see the king's dishonour, therefore have we sent and announced to the king, | בִּמְקוֹם, אֲשֶׁר תִּשְׁמְעוּ אֶת-קוֹל הַשּׁוֹפָר, שָׁמָּה, תִּקָּבְצוּ אֵלֵינוּ; אֱלֹהֵינוּ, יִלָּחֶם לָנוּ. | in what place soever ye hear the sound of the horn, resort ye thither unto us; our God will fight for us.'

text_he: די יבקר בספר-דכרניא די אבהתך ותהשכח בספר דכרניא ותנדע די קריתא דך קריא מרדא ומהנזקת מלכין ומדנן ואשתדור עבדין בגוה מן-יומת עלמא על-דנה--קריתא דך החרבת | that search may be made in the book of the records of thy fathers so shalt thou find in the book of the records and know that this city is a rebellious city and hurtful unto kings and provinces and that they have moved sedition within the same of old time for which cause was this city laid waste | ואנחנו עשים במלאכה וחצים מחזיקים ברמחים מעלות השחר עד צאת הכוכבים | So we wrought in the work and half of them held the spears from the rising of the morning till the stars appeared
text_en: that search may be made in the book of the records of thy fathers; so shalt thou find in the book of the records, and know that this city is a rebellious city, and hurtful unto kings and provinces, and that they have moved sedition within the same of old time; for which cause was this city laid waste.
text_pisuk: דִּי יְבַקַּר בִּסְפַר-דָּכְרָנַיָּא דִּי אֲבָהָתָךְ, וּתְהַשְׁכַּח בִּסְפַר דָּכְרָנַיָּא וְתִנְדַּע, דִּי קִרְיְתָא דָךְ קִרְיָא מָרָדָא וּמְהַנְזְקַת מַלְכִין וּמְדִנָן, וְאֶשְׁתַּדּוּר עָבְדִין בְּגַוַּהּ מִן-יוֹמָת עָלְמָא; עַל-דְּנָה--קִרְיְתָא דָךְ, הָחָרְבַת. | that search may be made in the book of the records of thy fathers; so shalt thou find in the book of the records, and know that this city is a rebellious city, and hurtful unto kings and provinces, and that they have moved sedition within the same of old time; for which cause was this city laid waste. | וַאֲנַחְנוּ, עֹשִׂים בַּמְּלָאכָה; וְחֶצְיָם, מַחֲזִיקִים בָּרְמָחִים, מֵעֲלוֹת הַשַּׁחַר, עַד צֵאת הַכּוֹכָבִים. | So we wrought in the work; and half of them held the spears from the rising of the morning till the stars appeared.

text_he: מהודעין אנחנה למלכא די הן קריתא דך תבנא ושוריה ישתכלון לקבל דנה--חלק בעבר נהרא לא איתי לך | We announce to the king that if this city be builded and the walls finished by this means thou shalt have no portion beyond the River' | גם בעת היא אמרתי לעם--איש ונערו ילינו בתוך ירושלם והיו-לנו הלילה משמר והיום מלאכה | Likewise at the same time said I unto the people 'Let every one with his servant lodge within Jerusalem that in the night they may be a guard to us and may labour in the day'
text_en: We announce to the king that, if this city be builded, and the walls finished, by this means thou shalt have no portion beyond the River.'
text_pisuk: מְהוֹדְעִין אֲנַחְנָה, לְמַלְכָּא, דִּי הֵן קִרְיְתָא דָךְ תִּתְבְּנֵא, וְשׁוּרַיָּה יִשְׁתַּכְלְלוּן: לָקֳבֵל דְּנָה--חֲלָק בַּעֲבַר נַהֲרָא, לָא אִיתַי לָךְ. | We announce to the king that, if this city be builded, and the walls finished, by this means thou shalt have no portion beyond the River.' | גַּם בָּעֵת הַהִיא, אָמַרְתִּי לָעָם--אִישׁ וְנַעֲרוֹ, יָלִינוּ בְּתוֹךְ יְרוּשָׁלִָם; וְהָיוּ-לָנוּ הַלַּיְלָה מִשְׁמָר, וְהַיּוֹם מְלָאכָה. | Likewise at the same time said I unto the people: 'Let every one with his servant lodge within Jerusalem, that in the night they may be a guard to us, and may labour in the day.'

text_he: פתגמא שלח מלכא על-רחום בעל-טעם ושמשי ספרא ושאר כנותהון די יתבין בשמרין--ושאר עבר-נהרה שלם וכעת | Then sent the king an answer unto Rehum the commander and to Shimshai the scribe and to the rest of their companions that dwell in Samaria and unto the rest beyond the River 'Peace and now{S} | ואין אני ואחי ונערי ואנשי המשמר אשר אחרי--אין-אנחנו פשטים בגדינו איש שלחו המים | So neither I nor my brethren nor my servants nor the men of the guard that followed me none of us put off our clothes every one that went to the water had his weapon{S}
text_en: Then sent the king an answer unto Rehum the commander, and to Shimshai the scribe, and to the rest of their companions that dwell in Samaria, and unto the rest beyond the River: 'Peace, and now{S}
text_pisuk: פִּתְגָמָא שְׁלַח מַלְכָּא, עַל-רְחוּם בְּעֵל-טְעֵם וְשִׁמְשַׁי סָפְרָא, וּשְׁאָר כְּנָוָתְהוֹן, דִּי יָתְבִין בְּשָׁמְרָיִן--וּשְׁאָר עֲבַר-נַהֲרָה שְׁלָם, וּכְעֶת. | Then sent the king an answer unto Rehum the commander, and to Shimshai the scribe, and to the rest of their companions that dwell in Samaria, and unto the rest beyond the River: 'Peace, and now{S} | וְאֵין אֲנִי וְאַחַי וּנְעָרַי, וְאַנְשֵׁי הַמִּשְׁמָר אֲשֶׁר אַחֲרַי--אֵין-אֲנַחְנוּ פֹשְׁטִים, בְּגָדֵינוּ; אִישׁ, שִׁלְחוֹ הַמָּיִם. | So neither I, nor my brethren, nor my servants, nor the men of the guard that followed me, none of us put off our clothes, every one that went to the water had his weapon.{S}

text_he: נשתונא די שלחתון עלינא--מפרש קרי קדמי
text_en: the letter which ye sent unto us hath been plainly read before me.
text_pisuk: נִשְׁתְּוָנָא, דִּי שְׁלַחְתּוּן עֲלֶינָא--מְפָרַשׁ קֱרִי, קָדָמָי.

text_he: ומני שים טעם ובקרו והשכחו די קריתא דך מן-יומת עלמא על-מלכין מתנשאה ומרד ואשתדור מתעבד-בה
text_en: And I decreed, and search hath been made, and it is found that this city of old time hath made insurrection against kings, and that rebellion and sedition have been made therein.
text_pisuk: וּמִנִּי, שִׂים טְעֵם, וּבַקַּרוּ וְהַשְׁכַּחוּ, דִּי קִרְיְתָא דָךְ מִן-יוֹמָת עָלְמָא עַל-מַלְכִין מִתְנַשְּׂאָה; וּמְרַד וְאֶשְׁתַּדּוּר, מִתְעֲבֶד-בַּהּ.

text_he: ומלכין תקיפין הו על-ירושלם ושליטין בכל עבר נהרה ומדה בלו והלך מתיהב להון
text_en: There have been mighty kings also over Jerusalem, who have ruled over all the country beyond the River; and tribute, impost, and toll, was paid unto them.
text_pisuk: וּמַלְכִין תַּקִּיפִין, הֲווֹ עַל-יְרוּשְׁלֶם, וְשַׁלִּיטִין, בְּכֹל עֲבַר נַהֲרָה; וּמִדָּה בְלוֹ וַהֲלָךְ, מִתְיְהֵב לְהוֹן.

text_he: כען שימו טעם לבטלא גבריא אלך וקריתא דך לא תבנא עד-מני טעמא יתשם
text_en: Make ye now a decree to cause these men to cease, and that this city be not builded, until a decree shall be made by me.
text_pisuk: כְּעַן שִׂימוּ טְּעֵם, לְבַטָּלָא גֻּבְרַיָּא אִלֵּךְ; וְקִרְיְתָא דָךְ לָא תִתְבְּנֵא, עַד-מִנִּי טַעְמָא יִתְּשָׂם.

text_he: וזהירין הו שלו למעבד על-דנה למה ישגא חבלא להנזקת מלכין
text_en: And take heed that ye be not slack herein; why should damage grow to the hurt of the kings?'{S}
text_pisuk: וּזְהִירִין הֱווֹ שָׁלוּ, לְמֶעְבַּד עַל-דְּנָה; לְמָה יִשְׂגֵּא חֲבָלָא, לְהַנְזָקַת מַלְכִין.

text_he: אדין מן-די פרשגן נשתונא די ארתחשתא מלכא קרי קדם-רחום ושמשי ספרא וכנותהון אזלו בהילו לירושלם על-יהודיא ובטלו המו באדרע וחיל
text_en: Then when the copy of king Artaxerxes' letter was read before Rehum, and Shimshai the scribe, and their companions, they went in haste to Jerusalem unto the Jews, and made them to cease by force and power.{S}
text_pisuk: אֱדַיִן, מִן-דִּי פַּרְשֶׁגֶן נִשְׁתְּוָנָא דִּי אַרְתַּחְשַׁשְׂתְּא מַלְכָּא, קֱרִי קֳדָם-רְחוּם וְשִׁמְשַׁי סָפְרָא, וּכְנָוָתְהוֹן; אֲזַלוּ בִבְהִילוּ לִירוּשְׁלֶם עַל-יְהוּדָיֵא, וּבַטִּלוּ הִמּוֹ בְּאֶדְרָע וְחָיִל.

text_he: באדין בטלת עבידת בית-אלהא די בירושלם והות בטלא עד שנת תרתין למלכות דריוש מלך-פרס
text_en: Then ceased the work of the house of God which is at Jerusalem; and it ceased unto the second year of the reign of Darius king of Persia.
text_pisuk: בֵּאדַיִן, בְּטֵלַת עֲבִידַת בֵּית-אֱלָהָא, דִּי, בִּירוּשְׁלֶם; וַהֲוָת, בָּטְלָא, עַד שְׁנַת תַּרְתֵּין, לְמַלְכוּת דָּרְיָוֶשׁ מֶלֶךְ-פָּרָס.

text_he: והתנבי חגי נביאה וזכריה בר-עדוא נביאיא על-יהודיא די ביהוד ובירושלם--בשם אלה ישראל עליהון | Now the prophets Haggai the prophet and Zechariah the son of Iddo prophesied unto the Jews that were in Judah and Jerusalem in the name of the God of Israel prophesied they unto them{S} | ותהי צעקת העם ונשיהם גדולה אל-אחיהם היהודים | Then there arose a great cry of the people and of their wives against their brethren the Jews
text_en: Now the prophets, Haggai the prophet, and Zechariah the son of Iddo, prophesied unto the Jews that were in Judah and Jerusalem; in the name of the God of Israel prophesied they unto them.{S}
text_pisuk: וְהִתְנַבִּי חַגַּי נְבִיָּאה, וּזְכַרְיָה בַר-עִדּוֹא נְבִיַּאיָּא, עַל-יְהוּדָיֵא, דִּי בִיהוּד וּבִירוּשְׁלֶם--בְּשֻׁם אֱלָהּ יִשְׂרָאֵל, עֲלֵיהוֹן. | Now the prophets, Haggai the prophet, and Zechariah the son of Iddo, prophesied unto the Jews that were in Judah and Jerusalem; in the name of the God of Israel prophesied they unto them.{S} | וַתְּהִי צַעֲקַת הָעָם וּנְשֵׁיהֶם, גְּדוֹלָה, אֶל-אֲחֵיהֶם, הַיְּהוּדִים. | Then there arose a great cry of the people and of their wives against their brethren the Jews.

text_he: באדין קמו זרבל בר-שאלתיאל וישוע בר-יוצדק ושריו למבנא בית אלהא די בירושלם ועמהון נביאיא די-אלהא מסעדין להון | Then rose up Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel and Jeshua the son of Jozadak and began to build the house of God which is at Jerusalem and with them were the prophets of God helping them | ויש אשר אמרים בנינו ובנתינו אנחנו רבים ונקחה דגן ונאכלה ונחיה | For there were that said 'We our sons and our daughters are many let us get for them corn that we may eat and live'
text_en: Then rose up Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and began to build the house of God which is at Jerusalem; and with them were the prophets of God, helping them.
text_pisuk: בֵּאדַיִן קָמוּ זְרֻבָּבֶל בַּר-שְׁאַלְתִּיאֵל, וְיֵשׁוּעַ בַּר-יוֹצָדָק, וְשָׁרִיו לְמִבְנֵא, בֵּית אֱלָהָא דִּי בִירוּשְׁלֶם; וְעִמְּהוֹן נְבִיַּאיָּא דִי-אֱלָהָא, מְסָעֲדִין לְהוֹן. | Then rose up Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and began to build the house of God which is at Jerusalem; and with them were the prophets of God, helping them. | וְיֵשׁ אֲשֶׁר אֹמְרִים, בָּנֵינוּ וּבְנֹתֵינוּ אֲנַחְנוּ רַבִּים; וְנִקְחָה דָגָן, וְנֹאכְלָה וְנִחְיֶה. | For there were that said: 'We, our sons and our daughters, are many; let us get for them corn, that we may eat and live.'

text_he: בה-זמנא אתה עליהון תני פחת עבר-נהרה ושתר בוזני--וכנותהון וכן אמרין להם--מן-שם לכם טעם ביתא דנה לבנא ואשרנא דנה לשכלה | At the same time came to them Tattenai the governor beyond the River and Shethar-bozenai and their companions and said thus unto them 'Who gave you a decree to build this house and to finish this structure'{S} | ויש אשר אמרים שדתינו וכרמינו ובתינו אנחנו ערבים ונקחה דגן ברעב | Some also there were that said 'We are mortgaging our fields and our vineyards and our houses let us get corn because of the dearth'
text_en: At the same time came to them Tattenai, the governor beyond the River, and Shethar-bozenai, and their companions, and said thus unto them: 'Who gave you a decree to build this house, and to finish this structure?'{S}
text_pisuk: בֵּהּ-זִמְנָא אֲתָה עֲלֵיהוֹן תַּתְּנַי פַּחַת עֲבַר-נַהֲרָה, וּשְׁתַר בּוֹזְנַי--וּכְנָוָתְהוֹן; וְכֵן, אָמְרִין לְהֹם--מַן-שָׂם לְכֹם טְעֵם בַּיְתָא דְנָה לִבְּנֵא, וְאֻשַּׁרְנָא דְנָה לְשַׁכְלָלָה. | At the same time came to them Tattenai, the governor beyond the River, and Shethar-bozenai, and their companions, and said thus unto them: 'Who gave you a decree to build this house, and to finish this structure?'{S} | וְיֵשׁ אֲשֶׁר אֹמְרִים, שְׂדֹתֵינוּ וּכְרָמֵינוּ וּבָתֵּינוּ אֲנַחְנוּ עֹרְבִים; וְנִקְחָה דָגָן, בָּרָעָב. | Some also there were that said: 'We are mortgaging our fields, and our vineyards, and our houses; let us get corn, because of the dearth.'

text_he: אדין כנמא אמרנא להם מן-אנון שמהת גבריא די-דנה בנינא בנין | 'Then spoke we unto them after this manner  What are the names of the men that build this building' | ויש אשר אמרים לוינו כסף למדת המלך שדתינו וכרמינו | There were also that said 'We have borrowed money for the king's tribute upon our fields and our vineyards
text_en: 'Then spoke we unto them after this manner : What are the names of the men that build this building?'
text_pisuk: אֱדַיִן כְּנֵמָא, אֲמַרְנָא לְּהֹם: מַן-אִנּוּן שְׁמָהָת גֻּבְרַיָּא, דִּי-דְנָה בִנְיָנָא בָּנַיִן. | 'Then spoke we unto them after this manner : What are the names of the men that build this building?' | וְיֵשׁ אֲשֶׁר אֹמְרִים, לָוִינוּ כֶסֶף לְמִדַּת הַמֶּלֶךְ, שְׂדֹתֵינוּ, וּכְרָמֵינוּ. | There were also that said: 'We have borrowed money for the king's tribute upon our fields and our vineyards.

text_he: ועין אלהם הות על-שבי יהודיא ולא-בטלו המו עד-טעמא לדריוש יהך ואדין יתיבון נשתונא על-דנה | But the eye of their God was upon the elders of the Jews and they did not make them cease till the matter should come to Darius and then answer should be returned by letter concerning it | ועתה כבשר אחינו בשרנו כבניהם בנינו והנה אנחנו כבשים את-בנינו ואת-בנתינו לעבדים ויש מבנתינו נכבשות ואין לאל ידנו ושדתינו וכרמינו לאחרים | Yet now our flesh is as the flesh of our brethren our children as their children and lo we bring into bondage our sons and our daughters to be servants and some of our daughters are brought into bondage already neither is it in our power to help it for other men have our fields and our vineyards'
text_en: But the eye of their God was upon the elders of the Jews, and they did not make them cease, till the matter should come to Darius, and then answer should be returned by letter concerning it.
text_pisuk: וְעֵין אֱלָהֲהֹם, הֲוָת עַל-שָׂבֵי יְהוּדָיֵא, וְלָא-בַטִּלוּ הִמּוֹ, עַד-טַעְמָא לְדָרְיָוֶשׁ יְהָךְ; וֶאֱדַיִן יְתִיבוּן נִשְׁתְּוָנָא, עַל-דְּנָה. | But the eye of their God was upon the elders of the Jews, and they did not make them cease, till the matter should come to Darius, and then answer should be returned by letter concerning it. | וְעַתָּה, כִּבְשַׂר אַחֵינוּ בְּשָׂרֵנוּ, כִּבְנֵיהֶם, בָּנֵינוּ; וְהִנֵּה אֲנַחְנוּ כֹבְשִׁים אֶת-בָּנֵינוּ וְאֶת-בְּנֹתֵינוּ לַעֲבָדִים, וְיֵשׁ מִבְּנֹתֵינוּ נִכְבָּשׁוֹת וְאֵין לְאֵל יָדֵנוּ, וּשְׂדֹתֵינוּ וּכְרָמֵינוּ, לַאֲחֵרִים. | Yet now our flesh is as the flesh of our brethren, our children as their children; and, lo, we bring into bondage our sons and our daughters to be servants, and some of our daughters are brought into bondage already; neither is it in our power to help it; for other men have our fields and our vineyards.'

text_he: פרשגן אגרתא די-שלח תני פחת עבר-נהרה ושתר בוזני וכנותה אפרסכיא די בעבר נהרה--על-דריוש מלכא | The copy of the letter that Tattenai the governor beyond the River and Shethar-bozenai and his companions the Apharesachites who were beyond the River sent unto Darius the king | ויחר לי מאד כאשר שמעתי את-זעקתם ואת הדברים האלה | And I was very angry when I heard their cry and these words
text_en: The copy of the letter that Tattenai, the governor beyond the River, and Shethar-bozenai, and his companions the Apharesachites, who were beyond the River, sent unto Darius the king;
text_pisuk: פַּרְשֶׁגֶן אִגַּרְתָּא דִּי-שְׁלַח תַּתְּנַי פַּחַת עֲבַר-נַהֲרָה, וּשְׁתַר בּוֹזְנַי וּכְנָוָתֵהּ, אֲפַרְסְכָיֵא, דִּי בַּעֲבַר נַהֲרָה--עַל-דָּרְיָוֶשׁ, מַלְכָּא. | The copy of the letter that Tattenai, the governor beyond the River, and Shethar-bozenai, and his companions the Apharesachites, who were beyond the River, sent unto Darius the king; | וַיִּחַר לִי, מְאֹד, כַּאֲשֶׁר שָׁמַעְתִּי אֶת-זַעֲקָתָם, וְאֵת הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה. | And I was very angry when I heard their cry and these words.

text_he: פתגמא שלחו עלוהי וכדנה כתיב בגוה לדריוש מלכא שלמא כלא | they sent a letter unto him wherein was written thus 'Unto Darius the king all peace{S} | וימלך לבי עלי ואריבה את-החרים ואת-הסגנים ואמרה להם משא איש-באחיו אתם נשאים (נשים) ואתן עליהם קהלה גדולה | Then I consulted with myself and contended with the nobles and the rulers and said unto them 'Ye lend upon pledge every one to his brother' And I held a great assembly against them
text_en: they sent a letter unto him, wherein was written thus: 'Unto Darius the king, all peace.{S}
text_pisuk: פִּתְגָמָא, שְׁלַחוּ עֲלוֹהִי; וְכִדְנָה כְּתִיב בְּגַוֵּהּ, לְדָרְיָוֶשׁ מַלְכָּא שְׁלָמָא כֹלָּא. | they sent a letter unto him, wherein was written thus: 'Unto Darius the king, all peace.{S} | וַיִּמָּלֵךְ לִבִּי עָלַי, וָאָרִיבָה אֶת-הַחֹרִים וְאֶת-הַסְּגָנִים, וָאֹמְרָה לָהֶם, מַשָּׁא אִישׁ-בְּאָחִיו אַתֶּם נשאים (נֹשִׁים); וָאֶתֵּן עֲלֵיהֶם, קְהִלָּה גְדוֹלָה. | Then I consulted with myself, and contended with the nobles and the rulers, and said unto them: 'Ye lend upon pledge, every one to his brother.' And I held a great assembly against them.

text_he: ידיע להוא למלכא די-אזלנא ליהוד מדינתא לבית אלהא רבא והוא מתבנא אבן גל ואע מתשם בכתליא ועבידתא דך אספרנא מתעבדא ומצלח בידהם | Be it known unto the king that we went into the province of Judah to the house of the great God which is builded with great stones and timber is laid in the walls and this work goeth on with diligence and prospereth in their hands{S} | ואמרה להם אנחנו קנינו את-אחינו היהודים הנמכרים לגוים כדי בנו וגם-אתם תמכרו את-אחיכם ונמכרו-לנו ויחרישו ולא מצאו דבר | And I said unto them 'We after our ability have redeemed our brethren the Jews that sold themselves unto the heathen and would ye nevertheless sell your brethren and should they sell themselves unto us' Then held they their peace and found never a word{S}
text_en: Be it known unto the king, that we went into the province of Judah, to the house of the great God, which is builded with great stones, and timber is laid in the walls, and this work goeth on with diligence and prospereth in their hands.{S}
text_pisuk: יְדִיעַ לֶהֱוֵא לְמַלְכָּא, דִּי-אֲזַלְנָא לִיהוּד מְדִינְתָּא לְבֵית אֱלָהָא רַבָּא, וְהוּא מִתְבְּנֵא אֶבֶן גְּלָל, וְאָע מִתְּשָׂם בְּכֻתְלַיָּא; וַעֲבִידְתָּא דָךְ אָסְפַּרְנָא מִתְעַבְדָא, וּמַצְלַח בְּיֶדְהֹם. | Be it known unto the king, that we went into the province of Judah, to the house of the great God, which is builded with great stones, and timber is laid in the walls, and this work goeth on with diligence and prospereth in their hands.{S} | וָאֹמְרָה לָהֶם, אֲנַחְנוּ קָנִינוּ אֶת-אַחֵינוּ הַיְּהוּדִים הַנִּמְכָּרִים לַגּוֹיִם כְּדֵי בָנוּ, וְגַם-אַתֶּם תִּמְכְּרוּ אֶת-אֲחֵיכֶם, וְנִמְכְּרוּ-לָנוּ; וַיַּחֲרִישׁוּ, וְלֹא מָצְאוּ דָּבָר. | And I said unto them: 'We after our ability have redeemed our brethren the Jews, that sold themselves unto the heathen; and would ye nevertheless sell your brethren, and should they sell themselves unto us?' Then held they their peace, and found never a word.{S}

text_he: אדין שאלנא לשביא אלך כנמא אמרנא להם מן-שם לכם טעם ביתא דנה למבניה ואשרנא דנה לשכלה | Then asked we those elders and said unto them thus Who gave you a decree to build this house and to finish this wall | ויאמר (ואמר) לא-טוב הדבר אשר-אתם עשים הלוא ביראת אלהינו תלכו מחרפת הגוים אויבינו | Also I said 'The thing that ye do is not good ought ye not to walk in the fear of our God because of the reproach of the heathen our enemies
text_en: Then asked we those elders, and said unto them thus: Who gave you a decree to build this house, and to finish this wall?
text_pisuk: אֱדַיִן, שְׁאֵלְנָא לְשָׂבַיָּא אִלֵּךְ, כְּנֵמָא, אֲמַרְנָא לְּהֹם: מַן-שָׂם לְכֹם טְעֵם, בַּיְתָא דְנָה לְמִבְנְיָה, וְאֻשַּׁרְנָא דְנָה, לְשַׁכְלָלָה. | Then asked we those elders, and said unto them thus: Who gave you a decree to build this house, and to finish this wall? | ויאמר (וָאֹמַר), לֹא-טוֹב הַדָּבָר אֲשֶׁר-אַתֶּם עֹשִׂים: הֲלוֹא בְּיִרְאַת אֱלֹהֵינוּ תֵּלֵכוּ, מֵחֶרְפַּת הַגּוֹיִם אוֹיְבֵינוּ. | Also I said: 'The thing that ye do is not good; ought ye not to walk in the fear of our God, because of the reproach of the heathen our enemies?

text_he: ואף שמהתהם שאלנא להם להודעותך--די נכתב שם-גבריא די בראשיהם | We asked them their names also to announce to thee that we might write the names of the men that were at the head of them{S} | וגם-אני אחי ונערי נשים בהם כסף ודגן נעזבה-נא את-המשא הזה | And I likewise my brethren and my servants have lent them money and corn I pray you let us leave off this exaction
text_en: We asked them their names also, to announce to thee, that we might write the names of the men that were at the head of them.{S}
text_pisuk: וְאַף שְׁמָהָתְהֹם שְׁאֵלְנָא לְהֹם, לְהוֹדָעוּתָךְ--דִּי נִכְתֻּב שֻׁם-גֻּבְרַיָּא, דִּי בְרָאשֵׁיהֹם. | We asked them their names also, to announce to thee, that we might write the names of the men that were at the head of them.{S} | וְגַם-אֲנִי אַחַי וּנְעָרַי, נֹשִׁים בָּהֶם כֶּסֶף וְדָגָן; נַעַזְבָה-נָּא, אֶת-הַמַּשָּׁא הַזֶּה. | And I likewise, my brethren and my servants, have lent them money and corn. I pray you, let us leave off this exaction.

text_he: וכנמא פתגמא התיבונא למר אנחנא המו עבדוהי די-אלה שמיא וארעא ובנין ביתא די-הוא בנה מקדמת דנה שנין שגיאן ומלך לישראל רב בנהי ושכלה | And thus they returned us answer saying We are the servants of the God of heaven and earth and build the house that was builded these many years ago which a great king of Israel builded and finished | השיבו נא להם כהיום שדתיהם כרמיהם זיתיהם--ובתיהם ומאת הכסף והדגן התירוש והיצהר אשר אתם נשים בהם | Restore I pray you to them even this day their fields their vineyards their oliveyards and their houses also the hundred pieces of silver and the corn the wine and the oil that ye exact of them'
text_en: And thus they returned us answer, saying: We are the servants of the God of heaven and earth, and build the house that was builded these many years ago, which a great king of Israel builded and finished.
text_pisuk: וּכְנֵמָא פִתְגָמָא, הֲתִיבוּנָא לְמֵמַר: אֲנַחְנָא הִמּוֹ עַבְדוֹהִי דִי-אֱלָהּ שְׁמַיָּא וְאַרְעָא, וּבָנַיִן בַּיְתָא דִּי-הֲוָא בְנֵה מִקַּדְמַת דְּנָה שְׁנִין שַׂגִּיאָן, וּמֶלֶךְ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל רַב, בְּנָהִי וְשַׁכְלְלֵהּ. | And thus they returned us answer, saying: We are the servants of the God of heaven and earth, and build the house that was builded these many years ago, which a great king of Israel builded and finished. | הָשִׁיבוּ נָא לָהֶם כְּהַיּוֹם, שְׂדֹתֵיהֶם כַּרְמֵיהֶם זֵיתֵיהֶם--וּבָתֵּיהֶם; וּמְאַת הַכֶּסֶף וְהַדָּגָן הַתִּירוֹשׁ וְהַיִּצְהָר, אֲשֶׁר אַתֶּם נֹשִׁים בָּהֶם. | Restore, I pray you, to them, even this day, their fields, their vineyards, their oliveyards, and their houses, also the hundred pieces of silver, and the corn, the wine, and the oil, that ye exact of them.'

text_he: להן מן-די הרגזו אבהתנא לאלה שמיא--יהב המו ביד נבוכדנצר מלך-בל כסדיא (כסדאה) וביתה דנה סתרה ועמה הגלי לבל | But because that our fathers had provoked the God of heaven He gave them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon the Chaldean who destroyed this house and carried the people away into Babylon{S} | ויאמרו נשיב ומהם לא נבקש--כן נעשה כאשר אתה אומר ואקרא את-הכהנים ואשביעם לעשות כדבר הזה | Then said they 'We will restore them and will require nothing of them so will we do even as thou sayest' Then I called the priests and took an oath of them that they should do according to this promise
text_en: But because that our fathers had provoked the God of heaven, He gave them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, the Chaldean, who destroyed this house, and carried the people away into Babylon.{S}
text_pisuk: לָהֵן, מִן-דִּי הַרְגִּזוּ אֲבָהָתַנָא לֶאֱלָהּ שְׁמַיָּא--יְהַב הִמּוֹ, בְּיַד נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר מֶלֶךְ-בָּבֶל כסדיא (כַּסְדָּאָה); וּבַיְתָה דְנָה סַתְרֵהּ, וְעַמָּה הַגְלִי לְבָבֶל. | But because that our fathers had provoked the God of heaven, He gave them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, the Chaldean, who destroyed this house, and carried the people away into Babylon.{S} | וַיֹּאמְרוּ נָשִׁיב, וּמֵהֶם לֹא נְבַקֵּשׁ--כֵּן נַעֲשֶׂה, כַּאֲשֶׁר אַתָּה אוֹמֵר; וָאֶקְרָא, אֶת-הַכֹּהֲנִים, וָאַשְׁבִּיעֵם, לַעֲשׂוֹת כַּדָּבָר הַזֶּה. | Then said they: 'We will restore them, and will require nothing of them; so will we do, even as thou sayest.' Then I called the priests, and took an oath of them, that they should do according to this promise.

text_he: ברם בשנת חדה לכורש מלכא די בל--כורש מלכא שם טעם בית-אלהא דנה לבנא | But in the first year of Cyrus king of Babylon Cyrus the king made a decree to build this house of God | גם-חצני נערתי ואמרה כה ינער האלהים את-כל-האיש אשר לא-יקים את-הדבר הזה מביתו ומיגיעו וכה יהיה נעור ורק ויאמרו כל-הקהל אמן ויהלו את-יהוה ויעש העם כדבר הזה | Also I shook out my lap and said 'So God shake out every man from his house and from his labour that performeth not this promise even thus be he shaken out and emptied' And all the congregation said 'Amen' and praised the LORD And the people did according to this promise
text_en: But in the first year of Cyrus king of Babylon, Cyrus the king made a decree to build this house of God.
text_pisuk: בְּרַם בִּשְׁנַת חֲדָה, לְכוֹרֶשׁ מַלְכָּא דִּי בָבֶל--כּוֹרֶשׁ מַלְכָּא שָׂם טְעֵם, בֵּית-אֱלָהָא דְנָה לִבְּנֵא. | But in the first year of Cyrus king of Babylon, Cyrus the king made a decree to build this house of God. | גַּם-חָצְנִי נָעַרְתִּי, וָאֹמְרָה כָּכָה יְנַעֵר הָאֱלֹהִים אֶת-כָּל-הָאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר לֹא-יָקִים אֶת-הַדָּבָר הַזֶּה מִבֵּיתוֹ וּמִיגִיעוֹ, וְכָכָה יִהְיֶה נָעוּר, וָרֵק; וַיֹּאמְרוּ כָל-הַקָּהָל אָמֵן, וַיְהַלְלוּ אֶת-יְהוָה, וַיַּעַשׂ הָעָם, כַּדָּבָר הַזֶּה. | Also I shook out my lap, and said: 'So God shake out every man from his house, and from his labour, that performeth not this promise; even thus be he shaken out, and emptied.' And all the congregation said: 'Amen', and praised the LORD. And the people did according to this promise.

text_he: ואף מאניא די-בית-אלהא די דהבה וכספא די נבוכדנצר הנפק מן-היכלא די בירושלם והיבל המו להיכלא די בל--הנפק המו כורש מלכא מן-היכלא די בל ויהיבו לשבצר שמה די פחה שמה | And the gold and silver vessels also of the house of God which Nebuchadnezzar took out of the temple that was in Jerusalem and brought them into the temple of Babylon those did Cyrus the king take out of the temple of Babylon and they were delivered unto one whose name was Sheshbazzar whom he had made governor | גם מיום אשר-צוה אותי להיות פחם בארץ יהודה משנת עשרים ועד שנת שלשים ושתים לארתחשסתא המלך שנים שתים עשרה--אני ואחי לחם הפחה לא אכלתי | Moreover from the time that I was appointed to be their governor in the land of Judah from the twentieth year even unto the two and thirtieth year of Artaxerxes the king that is twelve years I and my brethren have not eaten the bread of the governor
text_en: And the gold and silver vessels also of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took out of the temple that was in Jerusalem, and brought them into the temple of Babylon, those did Cyrus the king take out of the temple of Babylon, and they were delivered unto one whose name was Sheshbazzar, whom he had made governor;
text_pisuk: וְאַף מָאנַיָּא דִי-בֵית-אֱלָהָא, דִּי דַהֲבָה וְכַסְפָּא, דִּי נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר הַנְפֵּק מִן-הֵיכְלָא דִּי בִירוּשְׁלֶם, וְהֵיבֵל הִמּוֹ לְהֵיכְלָא דִּי בָבֶל--הַנְפֵּק הִמּוֹ כּוֹרֶשׁ מַלְכָּא, מִן-הֵיכְלָא דִּי בָבֶל, וִיהִיבוּ לְשֵׁשְׁבַּצַּר שְׁמֵהּ, דִּי פֶחָה שָׂמֵהּ. | And the gold and silver vessels also of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took out of the temple that was in Jerusalem, and brought them into the temple of Babylon, those did Cyrus the king take out of the temple of Babylon, and they were delivered unto one whose name was Sheshbazzar, whom he had made governor; | גַּם מִיּוֹם אֲשֶׁר-צִוָּה אוֹתִי, לִהְיוֹת פֶּחָם בְּאֶרֶץ יְהוּדָה, מִשְּׁנַת עֶשְׂרִים וְעַד שְׁנַת שְׁלֹשִׁים וּשְׁתַּיִם לְאַרְתַּחְשַׁסְתְּא הַמֶּלֶךְ, שָׁנִים שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה--אֲנִי וְאַחַי, לֶחֶם הַפֶּחָה לֹא אָכַלְתִּי. | Moreover from the time that I was appointed to be their governor in the land of Judah, from the twentieth year even unto the two and thirtieth year of Artaxerxes the king, that is, twelve years, I and my brethren have not eaten the bread of the governor.

text_he: ואמר-לה--אלה (אל) מאניא שא אזל-אחת המו בהיכלא די בירושלם ובית אלהא יתבנא על-אתרה | and he said unto him Take these vessels go put them in the temple that is in Jerusalem and let the house of God be builded in its place{S} | והפחות הראשנים אשר-לפני הכבידו על-העם ויקחו מהם בלחם וין אחר כסף-שקלים ארבעים--גם נעריהם שלטו על-העם ואני לא-עשיתי כן מפני יראת אלהים | But the former governors that were before me laid burdens upon the people and took of them for bread and wine above forty shekels of silver yea even their servants lorded over the people but so did not I because of the fear of God
text_en: and he said unto him: Take these vessels, go, put them in the temple that is in Jerusalem, and let the house of God be builded in its place.{S}
text_pisuk: וַאֲמַר-לֵהּ--אלה (אֵל) מָאנַיָּא, שֵׂא אֵזֶל-אֲחֵת הִמּוֹ בְּהֵיכְלָא דִּי בִירוּשְׁלֶם; וּבֵית אֱלָהָא, יִתְבְּנֵא עַל-אַתְרֵהּ. | and he said unto him: Take these vessels, go, put them in the temple that is in Jerusalem, and let the house of God be builded in its place.{S} | וְהַפַּחוֹת הָרִאשֹׁנִים אֲשֶׁר-לְפָנַי הִכְבִּידוּ עַל-הָעָם, וַיִּקְחוּ מֵהֶם בְּלֶחֶם וָיַיִן אַחַר כֶּסֶף-שְׁקָלִים אַרְבָּעִים--גַּם נַעֲרֵיהֶם, שָׁלְטוּ עַל-הָעָם; וַאֲנִי לֹא-עָשִׂיתִי כֵן, מִפְּנֵי יִרְאַת אֱלֹהִים. | But the former governors that were before me laid burdens upon the people, and took of them for bread and wine above forty shekels of silver; yea, even their servants lorded over the people; but so did not I, because of the fear of God.

text_he: אדין שבצר דך אתא יהב אשיא די-בית אלהא די בירושלם ומן-אדין ועד-כען מתבנא ולא שלם | Then came the same Sheshbazzar and laid the foundations of the house of God which is in Jerusalem and since that time even until now hath it been in building and yet it is not completed | וגם במלאכת החומה הזאת החזקתי ושדה לא קנינו וכל-נערי--קבוצים שם על-המלאכה | Yea also I set hand to the work of this wall neither bought we any land and all my servants were gathered thither unto the work
text_en: Then came the same Sheshbazzar, and laid the foundations of the house of God which is in Jerusalem; and since that time even until now hath it been in building, and yet it is not completed.
text_pisuk: אֱדַיִן, שֵׁשְׁבַּצַּר דֵּךְ, אֲתָא יְהַב אֻשַּׁיָּא דִּי-בֵית אֱלָהָא, דִּי בִירוּשְׁלֶם; וּמִן-אֱדַיִן וְעַד-כְּעַן מִתְבְּנֵא, וְלָא שְׁלִם. | Then came the same Sheshbazzar, and laid the foundations of the house of God which is in Jerusalem; and since that time even until now hath it been in building, and yet it is not completed. | וְגַם בִּמְלֶאכֶת הַחוֹמָה הַזֹּאת, הֶחֱזַקְתִּי, וְשָׂדֶה, לֹא קָנִינוּ; וְכָל-נְעָרַי--קְבוּצִים שָׁם, עַל-הַמְּלָאכָה. | Yea, also I set hand to the work of this wall, neither bought we any land; and all my servants were gathered thither unto the work.

text_he: וכען הן על-מלכא טב יתבקר בית גנזיא די-מלכא תמה די בל הן איתי די-מן-כורש מלכא שים טעם למבנא בית-אלהא דך בירושלם ורעות מלכא על-דנה ישלח עלינא | Now therefore if it seem good to the king let search be made in the king's treasure-house there which is at Babylon whether it be so that a decree was made of Cyrus the king to build this house of God at Jerusalem and let the king send his pleasure to us concerning this matter'{S} | והיהודים והסגנים מאה וחמשים איש והבאים אלינו מן-הגוים אשר-סביבתינו--על-שלחני | Moreover there were at my table of the Jews and the rulers a hundred and fifty men beside those that came unto us from among the nations that were round about us
text_en: Now therefore, if it seem good to the king, let search be made in the king's treasure-house there, which is at Babylon, whether it be so, that a decree was made of Cyrus the king to build this house of God at Jerusalem, and let the king send his pleasure to us concerning this matter.'{S}
text_pisuk: וּכְעַן הֵן עַל-מַלְכָּא טָב, יִתְבַּקַּר בְּבֵית גִּנְזַיָּא דִּי-מַלְכָּא תַמָּה דִּי בְּבָבֶל, הֵן אִיתַי דִּי-מִן-כּוֹרֶשׁ מַלְכָּא שִׂים טְעֵם, לְמִבְנֵא בֵּית-אֱלָהָא דֵךְ בִּירוּשְׁלֶם; וּרְעוּת מַלְכָּא עַל-דְּנָה, יִשְׁלַח עֲלֶינָא. | Now therefore, if it seem good to the king, let search be made in the king's treasure-house there, which is at Babylon, whether it be so, that a decree was made of Cyrus the king to build this house of God at Jerusalem, and let the king send his pleasure to us concerning this matter.'{S} | וְהַיְּהוּדִים וְהַסְּגָנִים מֵאָה וַחֲמִשִּׁים אִישׁ, וְהַבָּאִים אֵלֵינוּ מִן-הַגּוֹיִם אֲשֶׁר-סְבִיבֹתֵינוּ--עַל-שֻׁלְחָנִי. | Moreover there were at my table of the Jews and the rulers a hundred and fifty men, beside those that came unto us from among the nations that were round about us.

text_he: באדין דריוש מלכא שם טעם ובקרו בית ספריא די גנזיא מהחתין תמה--בל | Then Darius the king made a decree and search was made in the house of the archives where the treasures were laid up in Babylon | ויהי כאשר נשמע לסנבלט וטוביה ולגשם הערבי וליתר איבינו כי בניתי את-החומה ולא-נותר בה פרץ--גם עד-העת היא דלתות לא-העמדתי בשערים | Now it came to pass when it was reported to Sanballat and Tobiah and to Geshem the Arabian and unto the rest of our enemies that I had builded the wall and that there was no breach left therein--though even unto that time I had not set up the doors in the gates--
text_en: Then Darius the king made a decree, and search was made in the house of the archives, where the treasures were laid up, in Babylon.
text_pisuk: בֵּאדַיִן דָּרְיָוֶשׁ מַלְכָּא, שָׂם טְעֵם; וּבַקַּרוּ בְּבֵית סִפְרַיָּא, דִּי גִנְזַיָּא מְהַחֲתִין תַּמָּה--בְּבָבֶל. | Then Darius the king made a decree, and search was made in the house of the archives, where the treasures were laid up, in Babylon. | וַיְהִי כַאֲשֶׁר נִשְׁמַע לְסַנְבַלַּט וְטוֹבִיָּה וּלְגֶשֶׁם הָעַרְבִי וּלְיֶתֶר אֹיְבֵינוּ, כִּי בָנִיתִי אֶת-הַחוֹמָה, וְלֹא-נוֹתַר בָּהּ, פָּרֶץ--גַּם עַד-הָעֵת הַהִיא, דְּלָתוֹת לֹא-הֶעֱמַדְתִּי בַשְּׁעָרִים. | Now it came to pass, when it was reported to Sanballat and Tobiah, and to Geshem the Arabian, and unto the rest of our enemies, that I had builded the wall, and that there was no breach left therein--though even unto that time I had not set up the doors in the gates--

text_he: והשתכח באחמתא בירתא די במדי מדינתא--מגלה חדה וכן-כתיב בגוה דכרונה | And there was found at Ahmetha in the palace that is in the province of Media a roll and therein was thus written 'A record | וישלח סנבלט וגשם אלי לאמר לכה ונועדה יחדו בכפירים בקעת אונו והמה חשבים לעשות לי רעה | that Sanballat and Geshem sent unto me saying 'Come let us meet together in one of the villages in the plain of Ono' But they thought to do me mischief
text_en: And there was found at Ahmetha, in the palace that is in the province of Media, a roll, and therein was thus written: 'A record.
text_pisuk: וְהִשְׁתְּכַח בְּאַחְמְתָא, בְּבִירְתָא דִּי בְּמָדַי מְדִינְתָּא--מְגִלָּה חֲדָה; וְכֵן-כְּתִיב בְּגַוַּהּ, דִּכְרוֹנָה. | And there was found at Ahmetha, in the palace that is in the province of Media, a roll, and therein was thus written: 'A record. | וַיִּשְׁלַח סַנְבַלַּט וְגֶשֶׁם אֵלַי לֵאמֹר, לְכָה וְנִוָּעֲדָה יַחְדָּו בַּכְּפִירִים בְּבִקְעַת אוֹנוֹ; וְהֵמָּה, חֹשְׁבִים, לַעֲשׂוֹת לִי, רָעָה. | that Sanballat and Geshem sent unto me, saying: 'Come, let us meet together in one of the villages in the plain of Ono.' But they thought to do me mischief.

text_he: בשנת חדה לכורש מלכא כורש מלכא שם טעם--בית-אלהא בירושלם ביתא יתבנא אתר די-דבחין דבחין ואשוהי מסובלין רומה אמין שתין פתיה אמין שתין | In the first year of Cyrus the king Cyrus the king made a decree Concerning the house of God at Jerusalem let the house be builded the place where they offer sacrifices and let the foundations thereof be strongly laid the height thereof threescore cubits and the breadth thereof threescore cubits | ואשלחה עליהם מלאכים לאמר--מלאכה גדולה אני עשה ולא אוכל לרדת למה תשבת המלאכה כאשר ארפה וירדתי אליכם | And I sent messengers unto them saying 'I am doing a great work so that I cannot come down why should the work cease whilst I leave it and come down to you'
text_en: In the first year of Cyrus the king, Cyrus the king made a decree: Concerning the house of God at Jerusalem, let the house be builded, the place where they offer sacrifices, and let the foundations thereof be strongly laid; the height thereof threescore cubits, and the breadth thereof threescore cubits;
text_pisuk: בִּשְׁנַת חֲדָה לְכוֹרֶשׁ מַלְכָּא, כּוֹרֶשׁ מַלְכָּא שָׂם טְעֵם--בֵּית-אֱלָהָא בִירוּשְׁלֶם בַּיְתָא יִתְבְּנֵא, אֲתַר דִּי-דָבְחִין דִּבְחִין וְאֻשּׁוֹהִי מְסוֹבְלִין; רוּמֵהּ אַמִּין שִׁתִּין, פְּתָיֵהּ אַמִּין שִׁתִּין. | In the first year of Cyrus the king, Cyrus the king made a decree: Concerning the house of God at Jerusalem, let the house be builded, the place where they offer sacrifices, and let the foundations thereof be strongly laid; the height thereof threescore cubits, and the breadth thereof threescore cubits; | וָאֶשְׁלְחָה עֲלֵיהֶם מַלְאָכִים, לֵאמֹר--מְלָאכָה גְדוֹלָה אֲנִי עֹשֶׂה, וְלֹא אוּכַל לָרֶדֶת; לָמָּה תִשְׁבַּת הַמְּלָאכָה כַּאֲשֶׁר אַרְפֶּהָ, וְיָרַדְתִּי אֲלֵיכֶם. | And I sent messengers unto them, saying: 'I am doing a great work, so that I cannot come down; why should the work cease, whilst I leave it, and come down to you?'

text_he: נדבכין די-אבן גל תלתא ונדבך די-אע חדת ונפקתא--מן-בית מלכא תיהב | with three rows of great stones and a row of new timber and let the expenses be given out of the king's house | וישלחו אלי כדבר הזה ארבע פעמים ואשיב אותם כדבר הזה | And they sent unto me four times after this sort and I answered them after the same manner{S}
text_en: with three rows of great stones, and a row of new timber, and let the expenses be given out of the king's house;
text_pisuk: נִדְבָּכִין דִּי-אֶבֶן גְּלָל, תְּלָתָא, וְנִדְבָּךְ, דִּי-אָע חֲדַת; וְנִפְקְתָא--מִן-בֵּית מַלְכָּא, תִּתְיְהִב. | with three rows of great stones, and a row of new timber, and let the expenses be given out of the king's house; | וַיִּשְׁלְחוּ אֵלַי כַּדָּבָר הַזֶּה, אַרְבַּע פְּעָמִים; וָאָשִׁיב אוֹתָם, כַּדָּבָר הַזֶּה. | And they sent unto me four times after this sort; and I answered them after the same manner.{S}

text_he: ואף מאני בית-אלהא די דהבה וכספא די נבוכדנצר הנפק מן-היכלא די-בירושלם והיבל לבל--יהתיבון ויהך להיכלא די-בירושלם לאתרה ותחת בית אלהא | and also let the gold and silver vessels of the house of God which Nebuchadnezzar took forth out of the temple which is at Jerusalem and brought unto Babylon be restored and brought back unto the temple which is at Jerusalem every one to its place and thou shalt put them in the house of God'{S} | וישלח אלי סנבלט כדבר הזה פעם חמישית--את-נערו ואגרת פתוחה בידו | Then sent Sanballat his servant unto me in like manner the fifth time with an open letter in his hand
text_en: and also let the gold and silver vessels of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took forth out of the temple which is at Jerusalem, and brought unto Babylon, be restored, and brought back unto the temple which is at Jerusalem, every one to its place, and thou shalt put them in the house of God.'{S}
text_pisuk: וְאַף מָאנֵי בֵית-אֱלָהָא, דִּי דַהֲבָה וְכַסְפָּא, דִּי נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר הַנְפֵּק מִן-הֵיכְלָא דִי-בִירוּשְׁלֶם, וְהֵיבֵל לְבָבֶל--יַהֲתִיבוּן, וִיהָךְ לְהֵיכְלָא דִי-בִירוּשְׁלֶם לְאַתְרֵהּ, וְתַחֵת, בְּבֵית אֱלָהָא. | and also let the gold and silver vessels of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took forth out of the temple which is at Jerusalem, and brought unto Babylon, be restored, and brought back unto the temple which is at Jerusalem, every one to its place, and thou shalt put them in the house of God.'{S} | וַיִּשְׁלַח אֵלַי סַנְבַלַּט כַּדָּבָר הַזֶּה, פַּעַם חֲמִישִׁית--אֶת-נַעֲרוֹ; וְאִגֶּרֶת פְּתוּחָה, בְּיָדוֹ. | Then sent Sanballat his servant unto me in like manner the fifth time with an open letter in his hand;

text_he: כען תני פחת עבר-נהרה שתר בוזני וכנותהון אפרסכיא די בעבר נהרה--רחיקין הו מן-תמה | 'Now therefore Tattenai governor beyond the River Shethar-bozenai and your companions the Apharesachites who are beyond the River be ye far from thence | כתוב בה בגוים נשמע וגשמו אמר אתה והיהודים חשבים למרוד על-כן אתה בונה החומה ואתה הוה להם למלך--כדברים האלה | wherein was written 'It is reported among the nations and Geshem saith it that thou and the Jews think to rebel for which cause thou buildest the wall and thou wouldest be their king even according to these words
text_en: 'Now therefore, Tattenai, governor beyond the River, Shethar-bozenai, and your companions the Apharesachites, who are beyond the River, be ye far from thence;
text_pisuk: כְּעַן תַּתְּנַי פַּחַת עֲבַר-נַהֲרָה שְׁתַר בּוֹזְנַי, וּכְנָוָתְהוֹן, אֲפַרְסְכָיֵא, דִּי בַּעֲבַר נַהֲרָה--רַחִיקִין הֲווֹ, מִן-תַּמָּה. | 'Now therefore, Tattenai, governor beyond the River, Shethar-bozenai, and your companions the Apharesachites, who are beyond the River, be ye far from thence; | כָּתוּב בָּהּ, בַּגּוֹיִם נִשְׁמָע וְגַשְׁמוּ אֹמֵר, אַתָּה וְהַיְּהוּדִים חֹשְׁבִים לִמְרוֹד, עַל-כֵּן אַתָּה בוֹנֶה הַחוֹמָה; וְאַתָּה, הֹוֶה לָהֶם לְמֶלֶךְ--כַּדְּבָרִים, הָאֵלֶּה. | wherein was written: 'It is reported among the nations, and Geshem saith it, that thou and the Jews think to rebel; for which cause thou buildest the wall; and thou wouldest be their king, even according to these words.

text_he: שבקו לעבידת בית-אלהא דך פחת יהודיא ולשבי יהודיא בית-אלהא דך יבנון על-אתרה | let the work of this house of God alone let the governor of the Jews and the elders of the Jews build this house of God in its place | וגם-נביאים העמדת לקרא עליך בירושלם לאמר מלך ביהודה ועתה ישמע למלך כדברים האלה ועתה לכה ונועצה יחדו | And thou hast also appointed prophets to proclaim of thee at Jerusalem saying There is a king in Judah and now shall it be reported to the king according to these words Come now therefore and let us take counsel together'{S}
text_en: let the work of this house of God alone; let the governor of the Jews and the elders of the Jews build this house of God in its place.
text_pisuk: שְׁבֻקוּ, לַעֲבִידַת בֵּית-אֱלָהָא דֵךְ; פַּחַת יְהוּדָיֵא וּלְשָׂבֵי יְהוּדָיֵא, בֵּית-אֱלָהָא דֵךְ יִבְנוֹן עַל-אַתְרֵהּ. | let the work of this house of God alone; let the governor of the Jews and the elders of the Jews build this house of God in its place. | וְגַם-נְבִיאִים הֶעֱמַדְתָּ לִקְרֹא עָלֶיךָ בִירוּשָׁלִַם לֵאמֹר, מֶלֶךְ בִּיהוּדָה, וְעַתָּה יִשָּׁמַע לַמֶּלֶךְ, כַּדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה; וְעַתָּה לְכָה, וְנִוָּעֲצָה יַחְדָּו. | And thou hast also appointed prophets to proclaim of thee at Jerusalem, saying: There is a king in Judah; and now shall it be reported to the king according to these words. Come now therefore, and let us take counsel together.'{S}

text_he: ומני שים טעם--למא די-תעבדון עם-שבי יהודיא אלך למבנא בית-אלהא דך ומנכסי מלכא די מדת עבר נהרה אספרנא נפקתא תהוא מתיהבא לגבריא אלך די-לא לבטלא | Moreover I make a decree concerning what ye shall do to these elders of the Jews for the building of this house of God that of the king's goods even of the tribute beyond the River expenses be given with all diligence unto these men that they be not hindered | ואשלחה אליו לאמר--לא נהיה כדברים האלה אשר אתה אומר כי מלבך אתה בודאם | Then I sent unto him saying 'There are no such things done as thou sayest but thou feignest them out of thine own heart'
text_en: Moreover I make a decree concerning what ye shall do to these elders of the Jews for the building of this house of God; that of the king's goods, even of the tribute beyond the River, expenses be given with all diligence unto these men, that they be not hindered.
text_pisuk: וּמִנִּי, שִׂים טְעֵם--לְמָא דִי-תַעַבְדוּן עִם-שָׂבֵי יְהוּדָיֵא אִלֵּךְ, לְמִבְנֵא בֵּית-אֱלָהָא דֵךְ; וּמִנִּכְסֵי מַלְכָּא, דִּי מִדַּת עֲבַר נַהֲרָה, אָסְפַּרְנָא נִפְקְתָא תֶּהֱוֵא מִתְיַהֲבָא לְגֻבְרַיָּא אִלֵּךְ, דִּי-לָא לְבַטָּלָא. | Moreover I make a decree concerning what ye shall do to these elders of the Jews for the building of this house of God; that of the king's goods, even of the tribute beyond the River, expenses be given with all diligence unto these men, that they be not hindered. | וָאֶשְׁלְחָה אֵלָיו, לֵאמֹר--לֹא נִהְיָה כַּדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה, אֲשֶׁר אַתָּה אוֹמֵר: כִּי מִלִּבְּךָ, אַתָּה בוֹדָאם. | Then I sent unto him, saying: 'There are no such things done as thou sayest, but thou feignest them out of thine own heart.'

text_he: ומה חשחן ובני תורין ודכרין ואמרין לעלון לאלה שמיא חנטין מלח חמר ומשח כמאמר כהניא די-בירושלם להוא מתיהב להם יום ביום--די-לא שלו | And that which they have need of both young bullocks and rams and lambs for burnt-offerings to the God of heaven wheat salt wine and oil according to the word of the priests that are at Jerusalem let it be given them day by day without fail | כי כלם מיראים אותנו לאמר ירפו ידיהם מן-המלאכה ולא תעשה ועתה חזק את-ידי | For they all would have us afraid saying 'Their hands shall be weakened from the work that it be not done' But now strengthen Thou my hands
text_en: And that which they have need of, both young bullocks, and rams, and lambs, for burnt-offerings to the God of heaven, wheat, salt, wine, and oil, according to the word of the priests that are at Jerusalem, let it be given them day by day without fail;
text_pisuk: וּמָה חַשְׁחָן וּבְנֵי תוֹרִין וְדִכְרִין וְאִמְּרִין לַעֲלָוָן לֶאֱלָהּ שְׁמַיָּא חִנְטִין מְלַח חֲמַר וּמְשַׁח, כְּמֵאמַר כָּהֲנַיָּא דִי-בִירוּשְׁלֶם לֶהֱוֵא מִתְיְהֵב לְהֹם יוֹם בְּיוֹם--דִּי-לָא שָׁלוּ. | And that which they have need of, both young bullocks, and rams, and lambs, for burnt-offerings to the God of heaven, wheat, salt, wine, and oil, according to the word of the priests that are at Jerusalem, let it be given them day by day without fail; | כִּי כֻלָּם, מְיָרְאִים אוֹתָנוּ לֵאמֹר, יִרְפּוּ יְדֵיהֶם מִן-הַמְּלָאכָה, וְלֹא תֵעָשֶׂה; וְעַתָּה, חַזֵּק אֶת-יָדָי. | For they all would have us afraid, saying: 'Their hands shall be weakened from the work, that it be not done.' But now, strengthen Thou my hands.

text_he: די-להון מהקרבין ניחוחין לאלה שמיא ומצלין לחי מלכא ובנוהי | that they may offer sacrifices of sweet savour unto the God of heaven and pray for the life of the king and of his sons | ואני-באתי בית שמעיה בן-דליה בן-מהיטבאל--והוא עצור ויאמר נועד אל-בית האלהים אל-תוך היכל ונסגרה דלתות היכל--כי באים להרגך ולילה באים להרגך | And as for me I went unto the house of Shemaiah the son of Delaiah the son of Mehetabel who was shut up and he said 'Let us meet together in the house of God within the temple and let us shut the doors of the temple for they will come to slay thee yea in the night will they come to slay thee'
text_en: that they may offer sacrifices of sweet savour unto the God of heaven, and pray for the life of the king, and of his sons.
text_pisuk: דִּי-לֶהֱון מְהַקְרְבִין נִיחוֹחִין, לֶאֱלָהּ שְׁמַיָּא; וּמְצַלַּיִן, לְחַיֵּי מַלְכָּא וּבְנוֹהִי. | that they may offer sacrifices of sweet savour unto the God of heaven, and pray for the life of the king, and of his sons. | וַאֲנִי-בָאתִי, בֵּית שְׁמַעְיָה בֶן-דְּלָיָה בֶּן-מְהֵיטַבְאֵל--וְהוּא עָצוּר; וַיֹּאמֶר נִוָּעֵד אֶל-בֵּית הָאֱלֹהִים אֶל-תּוֹךְ הַהֵיכָל, וְנִסְגְּרָה דַּלְתוֹת הַהֵיכָל--כִּי בָּאִים לְהָרְגֶךָ, וְלַיְלָה בָּאִים לְהָרְגֶךָ. | And as for me, I went unto the house of Shemaiah the son of Delaiah the son of Mehetabel, who was shut up; and he said: 'Let us meet together in the house of God, within the temple, and let us shut the doors of the temple; for they will come to slay thee; yea, in the night will they come to slay thee.'

text_he: ומני שים טעם--די כל-אנש די יהשנא פתגמא דנה יתנסח אע מן-ביתה וזקיף יתמחא עלהי וביתה נולו יתעבד על-דנה | Also I have made a decree that whosoever shall alter this word let a beam be pulled out from his house and let him be lifted up and fastened thereon and let his house be made a dunghill for this | ואמרה האיש כמוני יברח ומי כמוני אשר-יבא אל-היכל וחי לא אבוא | And I said 'Should such a man as I flee and who is there that being such as I could go into the temple and live I will not go in'
text_en: Also I have made a decree, that whosoever shall alter this word, let a beam be pulled out from his house, and let him be lifted up and fastened thereon; and let his house be made a dunghill for this;
text_pisuk: וּמִנִּי, שִׂים טְעֵם--דִּי כָל-אֱנָשׁ דִּי יְהַשְׁנֵא פִּתְגָמָא דְנָה, יִתְנְסַח אָע מִן-בַּיְתֵהּ וּזְקִיף יִתְמְחֵא עֲלֹהִי; וּבַיְתֵהּ נְוָלוּ יִתְעֲבֵד, עַל-דְּנָה. | Also I have made a decree, that whosoever shall alter this word, let a beam be pulled out from his house, and let him be lifted up and fastened thereon; and let his house be made a dunghill for this; | וָאֹמְרָה, הַאִישׁ כָּמוֹנִי יִבְרָח, וּמִי כָמוֹנִי אֲשֶׁר-יָבֹא אֶל-הַהֵיכָל, וָחָי; לֹא, אָבוֹא. | And I said: 'Should such a man as I flee? and who is there, that, being such as I, could go into the temple and live? I will not go in.'

text_he: ואלהא די שכן שמה תמה ימגר כל-מלך ועם די ישלח ידה להשניה לחבלה בית-אלהא דך--די בירושלם אנה דריוש שמת טעם אספרנא יתעבד | and may the God that hath caused His name to dwell there overthrow all kings and peoples that shall put forth their hand to alter the same to destroy this house of God which is at Jerusalem I Darius have made a decree let it be done with all diligence' | ואכירה והנה לא-אלהים שלחו כי הנבואה דבר עלי וטוביה וסנבלט שכרו | And I discerned and lo God had not sent him for he pronounced this prophecy against me whereas Tobiah and Sanballat had hired him
text_en: and may the God that hath caused His name to dwell there overthrow all kings and peoples, that shall put forth their hand to alter the same, to destroy this house of God which is at Jerusalem. I Darius have made a decree; let it be done with all diligence.'
text_pisuk: וֵאלָהָא דִּי שַׁכִּן שְׁמֵהּ תַּמָּה, יְמַגַּר כָּל-מֶלֶךְ וְעַם דִּי יִשְׁלַח יְדֵהּ לְהַשְׁנָיָה לְחַבָּלָה בֵּית-אֱלָהָא דֵךְ--דִּי בִירוּשְׁלֶם; אֲנָה דָרְיָוֶשׁ שָׂמֶת טְעֵם, אָסְפַּרְנָא יִתְעֲבִד. | and may the God that hath caused His name to dwell there overthrow all kings and peoples, that shall put forth their hand to alter the same, to destroy this house of God which is at Jerusalem. I Darius have made a decree; let it be done with all diligence.' | וָאַכִּירָה, וְהִנֵּה לֹא-אֱלֹהִים שְׁלָחוֹ: כִּי הַנְּבוּאָה דִּבֶּר עָלַי, וְטוֹבִיָּה וְסַנְבַלַּט שְׂכָרוֹ. | And I discerned, and, lo, God had not sent him; for he pronounced this prophecy against me, whereas Tobiah and Sanballat had hired him.

text_he: אדין תני פחת עבר-נהרה שתר בוזני--וכנותהון לקבל די-שלח דריוש מלכא כנמא--אספרנא עבדו | Then Tattenai the governor beyond the River Shethar-bozenai and their companions because that Darius the king had thus sent acted with all diligence | למען שכור הוא למען-אירא ואעשה-כן וחטאתי והיה להם לשם רע למען יחרפוני | For this cause was he hired that I should be afraid and do so and sin and that they might have matter for an evil report that they might taunt me
text_en: Then Tattenai, the governor beyond the River, Shethar-bozenai, and their companions, because that Darius the king had thus sent, acted with all diligence.
text_pisuk: אֱדַיִן תַּתְּנַי פַּחַת עֲבַר-נַהֲרָה, שְׁתַר בּוֹזְנַי--וּכְנָוָתְהוֹן: לָקֳבֵל, דִּי-שְׁלַח דָּרְיָוֶשׁ מַלְכָּא כְּנֵמָא--אָסְפַּרְנָא עֲבַדוּ. | Then Tattenai, the governor beyond the River, Shethar-bozenai, and their companions, because that Darius the king had thus sent, acted with all diligence. | לְמַעַן שָׂכוּר הוּא, לְמַעַן-אִירָא וְאֶעֱשֶׂה-כֵּן וְחָטָאתִי; וְהָיָה לָהֶם לְשֵׁם רָע, לְמַעַן יְחָרְפוּנִי. | For this cause was he hired, that I should be afraid, and do so, and sin, and that they might have matter for an evil report, that they might taunt me.

text_he: ושבי יהודיא בנין ומצלחין בנבואת חגי נביאה וזכריה בר-עדוא ובנו ושכלו מן-טעם אלה ישראל ומטעם כורש ודריוש וארתחשתא מלך פרס | And the elders of the Jews builded and prospered through the prophesying of Haggai the prophet and Zechariah the son of Iddo And they builded and finished it according to the commandment of the God of Israel and according to the decree of Cyrus and Darius and Artaxerxes king of Persia | זכרה אלהי לטוביה ולסנבלט כמעשיו אלה וגם לנועדיה הנביאה וליתר הנביאים אשר היו מיראים אותי | Remember O my God Tobiah and Sanballat according to these their works and also the prophetess Noadiah and the rest of the prophets that would have me put in fear
text_en: And the elders of the Jews builded and prospered, through the prophesying of Haggai the prophet and Zechariah the son of Iddo. And they builded and finished it, according to the commandment of the God of Israel, and according to the decree of Cyrus, and Darius, and Artaxerxes king of Persia.
text_pisuk: וְשָׂבֵי יְהוּדָיֵא בָּנַיִן וּמַצְלְחִין, בִּנְבוּאַת חַגַּי נְבִיָּאה וּזְכַרְיָה בַּר-עִדּוֹא; וּבְנוֹ וְשַׁכְלִלוּ, מִן-טַעַם אֱלָהּ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וּמִטְּעֵם כּוֹרֶשׁ וְדָרְיָוֶשׁ, וְאַרְתַּחְשַׁשְׂתְּא מֶלֶךְ פָּרָס. | And the elders of the Jews builded and prospered, through the prophesying of Haggai the prophet and Zechariah the son of Iddo. And they builded and finished it, according to the commandment of the God of Israel, and according to the decree of Cyrus, and Darius, and Artaxerxes king of Persia. | זָכְרָה אֱלֹהַי לְטוֹבִיָּה וּלְסַנְבַלַּט, כְּמַעֲשָׂיו אֵלֶּה; וְגַם לְנוֹעַדְיָה הַנְּבִיאָה וּלְיֶתֶר הַנְּבִיאִים, אֲשֶׁר הָיוּ מְיָרְאִים אוֹתִי. | Remember, O my God, Tobiah and Sanballat according to these their works, and also the prophetess Noadiah, and the rest of the prophets, that would have me put in fear.

text_he: ושיציא ביתה דנה עד יום תלתה לירח אדר--די-היא שנת-שת למלכות דריוש מלכא | And this house was finished on the third day of the month Adar which was in the sixth year of the reign of Darius the king | ותשלם החומה בעשרים וחמשה לאלול--לחמשים ושנים יום | So the wall was finished in the twenty and fifth day of the month Elul in fifty and two days
text_en: And this house was finished on the third day of the month Adar, which was in the sixth year of the reign of Darius the king.
text_pisuk: וְשֵׁיצִיא בַּיְתָה דְנָה, עַד יוֹם תְּלָתָה לִירַח אֲדָר--דִּי-הִיא שְׁנַת-שֵׁת, לְמַלְכוּת דָּרְיָוֶשׁ מַלְכָּא. | And this house was finished on the third day of the month Adar, which was in the sixth year of the reign of Darius the king. | וַתִּשְׁלַם, הַחוֹמָה, בְּעֶשְׂרִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה, לֶאֱלוּל--לַחֲמִשִּׁים וּשְׁנַיִם, יוֹם. | So the wall was finished in the twenty and fifth day of the month Elul, in fifty and two days.

text_he: ועבדו בני-ישראל כהניא ולויא ושאר בני-גלותא חנכת בית-אלהא דנה--בחדוה | And the children of Israel the priests and the Levites and the rest of the children of the captivity kept the dedication of this house of God with joy | ויהי כאשר שמעו כל-אויבינו ויראו כל-הגוים אשר סביבתינו ויפלו מאד בעיניהם וידעו--כי מאת אלהינו נעשתה המלאכה הזאת | And it came to pass when all our enemies heard thereof that all the nations that were about us feared and were much cast down in their own eyes for they perceived that this work was wrought of our God
text_en: And the children of Israel, the priests and the Levites, and the rest of the children of the captivity, kept the dedication of this house of God with joy.
text_pisuk: וַעֲבַדוּ בְנֵי-יִשְׂרָאֵל כָּהֲנַיָּא וְלֵוָיֵא וּשְׁאָר בְּנֵי-גָלוּתָא, חֲנֻכַּת בֵּית-אֱלָהָא דְנָה--בְּחֶדְוָה. | And the children of Israel, the priests and the Levites, and the rest of the children of the captivity, kept the dedication of this house of God with joy. | וַיְהִי, כַּאֲשֶׁר שָׁמְעוּ כָּל-אוֹיְבֵינוּ, וַיִּרְאוּ כָּל-הַגּוֹיִם אֲשֶׁר סְבִיבֹתֵינוּ, וַיִּפְּלוּ מְאֹד בְּעֵינֵיהֶם; וַיֵּדְעוּ--כִּי מֵאֵת אֱלֹהֵינוּ, נֶעֶשְׂתָה הַמְּלָאכָה הַזֹּאת. | And it came to pass, when all our enemies heard thereof, that all the nations that were about us feared, and were much cast down in their own eyes; for they perceived that this work was wrought of our God.

text_he: והקרבו לחנכת בית-אלהא דנה תורין מאה דכרין מאתין אמרין ארבע מאה וצפירי עזין לחטיא (לחטאה) על-כל-ישראל תרי-עשר--למנין שבטי ישראל | And they offered at the dedication of this house of God a hundred bullocks two hundred rams four hundred lambs and for a sin-offering for all Israel twelve he-goats according to the number of the tribes of Israel | גם בימים הם מרבים חרי יהודה אגרתיהם הולכות על-טוביה ואשר לטוביה באות אליהם | Moreover in those days the nobles of Judah sent many letters unto Tobiah and the letters of Tobiah came unto them
text_en: And they offered at the dedication of this house of God a hundred bullocks, two hundred rams, four hundred lambs; and for a sin-offering for all Israel, twelve he-goats, according to the number of the tribes of Israel.
text_pisuk: וְהַקְרִבוּ, לַחֲנֻכַּת בֵּית-אֱלָהָא דְנָה, תּוֹרִין מְאָה, דִּכְרִין מָאתַיִן אִמְּרִין אַרְבַּע מְאָה; וּצְפִירֵי עִזִּין לחטיא (לְחַטָּאָה) עַל-כָּל-יִשְׂרָאֵל, תְּרֵי-עֲשַׂר--לְמִנְיָן, שִׁבְטֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל. | And they offered at the dedication of this house of God a hundred bullocks, two hundred rams, four hundred lambs; and for a sin-offering for all Israel, twelve he-goats, according to the number of the tribes of Israel. | גַּם בַּיָּמִים הָהֵם, מַרְבִּים חֹרֵי יְהוּדָה אִגְּרֹתֵיהֶם, הוֹלְכוֹת, עַל-טוֹבִיָּה; וַאֲשֶׁר לְטוֹבִיָּה, בָּאוֹת אֲלֵיהֶם. | Moreover in those days the nobles of Judah sent many letters unto Tobiah, and the letters of Tobiah came unto them.

text_he: והקימו כהניא בפלגתהון ולויא במחלקתהון על-עבידת אלהא די בירושלם כתב ספר משה | And they set the priests in their divisions and the Levites in their courses for the service of God which is at Jerusalem as it is written in the book of Moses | כי-רבים ביהודה בעלי שבועה לו--כי-חתן הוא לשכניה בן-ארח ויהוחנן בנו--לקח את-בת-משלם בן ברכיה | For there were many in Judah sworn unto him because he was the son-in-law of Shecaniah the son of Arah and his son Jehohanan had taken the daughter of Meshullam the son of Berechiah to wife
text_en: And they set the priests in their divisions, and the Levites in their courses, for the service of God, which is at Jerusalem; as it is written in the book of Moses.
text_pisuk: וַהֲקִימוּ כָהֲנַיָּא בִּפְלֻגָּתְהוֹן, וְלֵוָיֵא בְּמַחְלְקָתְהוֹן, עַל-עֲבִידַת אֱלָהָא, דִּי בִירוּשְׁלֶם: כִּכְתָב, סְפַר מֹשֶׁה. | And they set the priests in their divisions, and the Levites in their courses, for the service of God, which is at Jerusalem; as it is written in the book of Moses. | כִּי-רַבִּים בִּיהוּדָה, בַּעֲלֵי שְׁבוּעָה לוֹ--כִּי-חָתָן הוּא, לִשְׁכַנְיָה בֶן-אָרַח; וִיהוֹחָנָן בְּנוֹ--לָקַח, אֶת-בַּת-מְשֻׁלָּם בֶּן בֶּרֶכְיָה. | For there were many in Judah sworn unto him, because he was the son-in-law of Shecaniah the son of Arah; and his son Jehohanan had taken the daughter of Meshullam the son of Berechiah to wife.

text_he: ויעשו בני-הגולה את-הפסח--בארבעה עשר לחדש הראשון | And the children of the captivity kept the passover upon the fourteenth day of the first month | גם טובתיו היו אמרים לפני ודברי היו מוציאים לו אגרות שלח טוביה ליראני | Also they spoke of his good deeds before me and reported my words to him And Tobiah sent letters to put me in fear
text_en: And the children of the captivity kept the passover upon the fourteenth day of the first month.
text_pisuk: וַיַּעֲשׂוּ בְנֵי-הַגּוֹלָה, אֶת-הַפָּסַח--בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, לַחֹדֶשׁ הָרִאשׁוֹן. | And the children of the captivity kept the passover upon the fourteenth day of the first month. | גַּם טוֹבֹתָיו, הָיוּ אֹמְרִים לְפָנַי, וּדְבָרַי, הָיוּ מוֹצִיאִים לוֹ; אִגְּרוֹת שָׁלַח טוֹבִיָּה, לְיָרְאֵנִי. | Also they spoke of his good deeds before me, and reported my words to him. And Tobiah sent letters to put me in fear.

text_he: כי הטהרו הכהנים והלוים כאחד--כלם טהורים וישחטו הפסח לכל-בני הגולה ולאחיהם הכהנים ולהם
text_en: For the priests and the Levites had purified themselves together; all of them were pure; and they killed the passover lamb for all the children of the captivity, and for their brethren the priests, and for themselves.
text_pisuk: כִּי הִטַּהֲרוּ הַכֹּהֲנִים וְהַלְוִיִּם, כְּאֶחָד--כֻּלָּם טְהוֹרִים; וַיִּשְׁחֲטוּ הַפֶּסַח לְכָל-בְּנֵי הַגּוֹלָה, וְלַאֲחֵיהֶם הַכֹּהֲנִים וְלָהֶם.

text_he: ויאכלו בני-ישראל השבים מהגולה וכל הנבדל מטמאת גוי-הארץ אלהם--לדרש ליהוה אלהי ישראל
text_en: And the children of Israel, that were come back out of the captivity, and all such as had separated themselves unto them from the filthiness of the nations of the land, to seek the LORD, the God of Israel, did eat,
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאכְלוּ בְנֵי-יִשְׂרָאֵל, הַשָּׁבִים מֵהַגּוֹלָה, וְכֹל הַנִּבְדָּל מִטֻּמְאַת גּוֹיֵ-הָאָרֶץ, אֲלֵהֶם--לִדְרֹשׁ, לַיהוָה אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל.

text_he: ויעשו חג-מצות שבעת ימים בשמחה כי שמחם יהוה והסב לב מלך-אשור עליהם--לחזק ידיהם במלאכת בית-האלהים אלהי ישראל
text_en: and kept the feast of unleavened bread seven days with joy; for the LORD had made them joyful, and had turned the heart of the king of Assyria unto them, to strengthen their hands in the work of the house of God, the God of Israel.
text_pisuk: וַיַּעֲשׂוּ חַג-מַצּוֹת שִׁבְעַת יָמִים, בְּשִׂמְחָה: כִּי שִׂמְּחָם יְהוָה, וְהֵסֵב לֵב מֶלֶךְ-אַשּׁוּר עֲלֵיהֶם--לְחַזֵּק יְדֵיהֶם, בִּמְלֶאכֶת בֵּית-הָאֱלֹהִים אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל.

text_he: ואחר הדברים האלה במלכות ארתחשסתא מלך-פרס--עזרא בן-שריה בן-עזריה בן-חלקיה | Now after these things in the reign of Artaxerxes king of Persia Ezra the son of Seraiah the son of Azariah the son of Hilkiah | ויהי כאשר נבנתה החומה ואעמיד הדלתות ויפקדו השוערים והמשרים והלוים | Now it came to pass when the wall was built and I had set up the doors and the porters and the singers and the Levites were appointed
text_en: Now after these things, in the reign of Artaxerxes king of Persia, Ezra the son of Seraiah, the son of Azariah, the son of Hilkiah,
text_pisuk: וְאַחַר הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה, בְּמַלְכוּת אַרְתַּחְשַׁסְתְּא מֶלֶךְ-פָּרָס--עֶזְרָא, בֶּן-שְׂרָיָה, בֶּן-עֲזַרְיָה, בֶּן-חִלְקִיָּה. | Now after these things, in the reign of Artaxerxes king of Persia, Ezra the son of Seraiah, the son of Azariah, the son of Hilkiah, | וַיְהִי, כַּאֲשֶׁר נִבְנְתָה הַחוֹמָה, וָאַעֲמִיד, הַדְּלָתוֹת; וַיִּפָּקְדוּ הַשּׁוֹעֲרִים וְהַמְשֹׁרְרִים, וְהַלְוִיִּם. | Now it came to pass, when the wall was built, and I had set up the doors, and the porters and the singers and the Levites were appointed,

text_he: בן-שלום בן-צדוק בן-אחיטוב | the son of Shallum the son of Zadok the son of Ahitub | ואצוה את-חני אחי ואת-חניה שר הבירה--על-ירושלם כי-הוא כאיש אמת וירא את-האלהים מרבים | that I gave my brother Hanani and Hananiah the governor of the castle charge over Jerusalem for he was a faithful man and feared God above many
text_en: the son of Shallum, the son of Zadok, the son of Ahitub,
text_pisuk: בֶּן-שַׁלּוּם בֶּן-צָדוֹק, בֶּן-אֲחִיטוּב. | the son of Shallum, the son of Zadok, the son of Ahitub, | וָאֲצַוֶּה אֶת-חֲנָנִי אָחִי, וְאֶת-חֲנַנְיָה שַׂר הַבִּירָה--עַל-יְרוּשָׁלִָם: כִּי-הוּא כְּאִישׁ אֱמֶת, וְיָרֵא אֶת-הָאֱלֹהִים מֵרַבִּים. | that I gave my brother Hanani, and Hananiah the governor of the castle, charge over Jerusalem; for he was a faithful man, and feared God above many.

text_he: בן-אמריה בן-עזריה בן-מריות | the son of Amariah the son of Azariah the son of Meraioth | ויאמר (ואמר) להם לא יפתחו שערי ירושלם עד-חם השמש ועד הם עמדים יגיפו הדלתות ואחזו והעמיד משמרות ישבי ירושלם--איש במשמרו ואיש נגד ביתו | And I said unto them 'Let not the gates of Jerusalem be opened until the sun be hot and while they stand on guard let them shut the doors and bar ye them and let watches be appointed of the inhabitants of Jerusalem every one in his watch and every one to be over against his house'
text_en: the son of Amariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Meraioth,
text_pisuk: בֶּן-אֲמַרְיָה בֶן-עֲזַרְיָה, בֶּן-מְרָיוֹת. | the son of Amariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Meraioth, | ויאמר (וָאֹמַר) לָהֶם, לֹא יִפָּתְחוּ שַׁעֲרֵי יְרוּשָׁלִַם עַד-חֹם הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ, וְעַד הֵם עֹמְדִים יָגִיפוּ הַדְּלָתוֹת, וֶאֱחֹזוּ; וְהַעֲמֵיד, מִשְׁמְרוֹת יֹשְׁבֵי יְרוּשָׁלִַם--אִישׁ בְּמִשְׁמָרוֹ, וְאִישׁ נֶגֶד בֵּיתוֹ. | And I said unto them: 'Let not the gates of Jerusalem be opened until the sun be hot; and while they stand on guard, let them shut the doors, and bar ye them; and let watches be appointed of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, every one in his watch, and every one to be over against his house.'

text_he: בן-זרחיה בן-עזי בן-בקי | the son of Zerahiah the son of Uzzi the son of Bukki | והעיר רחבת ידים וגדלה והעם מעט בתוכה ואין בתים בנוים | Now the city was wide and large but the people were few therein and the houses were not builded
text_en: the son of Zerahiah, the son of Uzzi, the son of Bukki,
text_pisuk: בֶּן-זְרַחְיָה בֶן-עֻזִּי, בֶּן-בֻּקִּי. | the son of Zerahiah, the son of Uzzi, the son of Bukki, | וְהָעִיר רַחֲבַת יָדַיִם, וּגְדֹלָה, וְהָעָם מְעַט, בְּתוֹכָהּ; וְאֵין בָּתִּים, בְּנוּיִם. | Now the city was wide and large; but the people were few therein, and the houses were not builded.

text_he: בן-אבישוע בן-פינחס בן-אלעזר בן-אהרן הכהן הראש | the son of Abishua the son of Phinehas the son of Eleazar the son of Aaron the chief priest-- | ויתן אלהי אל-לבי ואקבצה את-החרים ואת-הסגנים ואת-העם להתיחש ואמצא ספר היחש העולים בראשונה ואמצא כתוב בו | And my God put into my heart to gather together the nobles and the rulers and the people that they might be reckoned by genealogy And I found the book of the genealogy of them that came up at the first and I found written therein
text_en: the son of Abishua, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the chief priest--
text_pisuk: בֶּן-אֲבִישׁוּעַ, בֶּן-פִּינְחָס בֶּן-אֶלְעָזָר, בֶּן-אַהֲרֹן הַכֹּהֵן, הָרֹאשׁ. | the son of Abishua, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the chief priest-- | וַיִּתֵּן אֱלֹהַי אֶל-לִבִּי, וָאֶקְבְּצָה אֶת-הַחֹרִים וְאֶת-הַסְּגָנִים וְאֶת-הָעָם לְהִתְיַחֵשׂ; וָאֶמְצָא, סֵפֶר הַיַּחַשׂ הָעוֹלִים בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה, וָאֶמְצָא, כָּתוּב בּוֹ. | And my God put into my heart to gather together the nobles, and the rulers, and the people, that they might be reckoned by genealogy. And I found the book of the genealogy of them that came up at the first, and I found written therein:

text_he: הוא עזרא עלה מבל והוא-ספר מהיר בתורת משה אשר-נתן יהוה אלהי ישראל ויתן-לו המלך כיד-יהוה אלהיו עליו--כל בקשתו | this Ezra went up from Babylon and he was a ready scribe in the Law of Moses which the LORD the God of Israel had given and the king granted him all his request according to the hand of the LORD his God upon him | אלה בני המדינה העלים משבי הגולה אשר הגלה נבוכדנצר מלך בל וישובו לירושלם וליהודה איש לעירו | These are the children of the province that went up out of the captivity of those that had been carried away whom Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon had carried away and that returned unto Jerusalem and to Judah every one unto his city
text_en: this Ezra went up from Babylon; and he was a ready scribe in the Law of Moses, which the LORD, the God of Israel, had given; and the king granted him all his request, according to the hand of the LORD his God upon him.
text_pisuk: הוּא עֶזְרָא, עָלָה מִבָּבֶל, וְהוּא-סֹפֵר מָהִיר בְּתוֹרַת מֹשֶׁה, אֲשֶׁר-נָתַן יְהוָה אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל; וַיִּתֶּן-לוֹ הַמֶּלֶךְ, כְּיַד-יְהוָה אֱלֹהָיו עָלָיו--כֹּל, בַּקָּשָׁתוֹ. | this Ezra went up from Babylon; and he was a ready scribe in the Law of Moses, which the LORD, the God of Israel, had given; and the king granted him all his request, according to the hand of the LORD his God upon him. | אֵלֶּה בְּנֵי הַמְּדִינָה, הָעֹלִים מִשְּׁבִי הַגּוֹלָה, אֲשֶׁר הֶגְלָה, נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל; וַיָּשׁוּבוּ לִירוּשָׁלִַם וְלִיהוּדָה, אִישׁ לְעִירוֹ. | These are the children of the province, that went up out of the captivity of those that had been carried away, whom Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon had carried away, and that returned unto Jerusalem and to Judah, every one unto his city;

text_he: ויעלו מבני-ישראל ומן-הכהנים והלוים והמשרים והשערים והנתינים--אל-ירושלם בשנת-שבע לארתחשסתא המלך | And there went up some of the children of Israel and of the priests and the Levites and the singers and the porters and the Nethinim unto Jerusalem in the seventh year of Artaxerxes the king | הבאים עם-זרבל ישוע נחמיה עזריה רעמיה נחמני מרדכי בלשן מספרת בגוי--נחום בענה מספר אנשי עם ישראל | who came with Zerubbabel Jeshua Nehemiah Azariah Raamiah Nahamani Mordecai Bilshan Mispereth Bigvai Nehum Baanah The number of the men of the people of Israel{S}
text_en: And there went up some of the children of Israel, and of the priests, and the Levites, and the singers, and the porters, and the Nethinim, unto Jerusalem, in the seventh year of Artaxerxes the king.
text_pisuk: וַיַּעֲלוּ מִבְּנֵי-יִשְׂרָאֵל וּמִן-הַכֹּהֲנִים וְהַלְוִיִּם וְהַמְשֹׁרְרִים וְהַשֹּׁעֲרִים, וְהַנְּתִינִים--אֶל-יְרוּשָׁלִָם: בִּשְׁנַת-שֶׁבַע, לְאַרְתַּחְשַׁסְתְּא הַמֶּלֶךְ. | And there went up some of the children of Israel, and of the priests, and the Levites, and the singers, and the porters, and the Nethinim, unto Jerusalem, in the seventh year of Artaxerxes the king. | הַבָּאִים עִם-זְרֻבָּבֶל, יֵשׁוּעַ נְחֶמְיָה עֲזַרְיָה רַעַמְיָה נַחֲמָנִי מָרְדֳּכַי בִּלְשָׁן מִסְפֶּרֶת בִּגְוַי--נְחוּם בַּעֲנָה: מִסְפַּר, אַנְשֵׁי עַם יִשְׂרָאֵל. | who came with Zerubbabel, Jeshua, Nehemiah, Azariah, Raamiah, Nahamani, Mordecai, Bilshan, Mispereth, Bigvai, Nehum, Baanah. The number of the men of the people of Israel:{S}

text_he: ויבא ירושלם בחדש החמישי היא שנת השביעית למלך | And he came to Jerusalem in the fifth month which was in the seventh year of the king | בני פרעש--אלפים מאה ושבעים ושנים | The children of Parosh two thousand a hundred and seventy and two{S}
text_en: And he came to Jerusalem in the fifth month, which was in the seventh year of the king.
text_pisuk: וַיָּבֹא יְרוּשָׁלִַם, בַּחֹדֶשׁ הַחֲמִישִׁי: הִיא שְׁנַת הַשְּׁבִיעִית, לַמֶּלֶךְ. | And he came to Jerusalem in the fifth month, which was in the seventh year of the king. | בְּנֵי פַרְעֹשׁ--אַלְפַּיִם, מֵאָה וְשִׁבְעִים וּשְׁנָיִם. | The children of Parosh, two thousand a hundred and seventy and two.{S}

text_he: כי באחד לחדש הראשון--הוא יסד המעלה מבל ובאחד לחדש החמישי בא אל-ירושלם כיד-אלהיו הטובה עליו | For upon the first day of the first month began he to go up from Babylon and on the first day of the fifth month came he to Jerusalem according to the good hand of his God upon him | בני שפטיה שלש מאות שבעים ושנים | The children of Shephatiah three hundred seventy and two{S}
text_en: For upon the first day of the first month began he to go up from Babylon, and on the first day of the fifth month came he to Jerusalem, according to the good hand of his God upon him.
text_pisuk: כִּי, בְּאֶחָד לַחֹדֶשׁ הָרִאשׁוֹן--הוּא יְסֻד, הַמַּעֲלָה מִבָּבֶל; וּבְאֶחָד לַחֹדֶשׁ הַחֲמִישִׁי, בָּא אֶל-יְרוּשָׁלִַם, כְּיַד-אֱלֹהָיו, הַטּוֹבָה עָלָיו. | For upon the first day of the first month began he to go up from Babylon, and on the first day of the fifth month came he to Jerusalem, according to the good hand of his God upon him. | בְּנֵי שְׁפַטְיָה, שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת שִׁבְעִים וּשְׁנָיִם. | The children of Shephatiah, three hundred seventy and two.{S}

text_he: כי עזרא הכין לבו לדרש את-תורת יהוה ולעשת ולמד בישראל חק ומשפט | For Ezra had set his heart to seek the law of the LORD and to do it and to teach in Israel statutes and ordinances{S} | בני ארח ש מאות חמשים ושנים | The children of Arah six hundred fifty and two{S}
text_en: For Ezra had set his heart to seek the law of the LORD, and to do it, and to teach in Israel statutes and ordinances.{S}
text_pisuk: כִּי עֶזְרָא הֵכִין לְבָבוֹ, לִדְרֹשׁ אֶת-תּוֹרַת יְהוָה וְלַעֲשֹׂת, וּלְלַמֵּד בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל, חֹק וּמִשְׁפָּט. | For Ezra had set his heart to seek the law of the LORD, and to do it, and to teach in Israel statutes and ordinances.{S} | בְּנֵי אָרַח, שֵׁשׁ מֵאוֹת חֲמִשִּׁים וּשְׁנָיִם. | The children of Arah, six hundred fifty and two.{S}

text_he: וזה פרשגן הנשתון אשר נתן המלך ארתחשסתא לעזרא הכהן הספר ספר דברי מצות-יהוה וחקיו--על-ישראל | Now this is the copy of the letter that the king Artaxerxes gave unto Ezra the priest the scribe even the scribe of the words of the commandments of the LORD and of His statutes to Israel | בני-פחת מואב לבני ישוע ויואב--אלפים ושמנה מאות שמנה עשר | The children of Pahath-moab of the children of Jeshua and Joab two thousand and eight hundred and eighteen{S}
text_en: Now this is the copy of the letter that the king Artaxerxes gave unto Ezra the priest, the scribe, even the scribe of the words of the commandments of the LORD, and of His statutes to Israel:
text_pisuk: וְזֶה פַּרְשֶׁגֶן הַנִּשְׁתְּוָן, אֲשֶׁר נָתַן הַמֶּלֶךְ אַרְתַּחְשַׁסְתְּא, לְעֶזְרָא הַכֹּהֵן, הַסֹּפֵר: סֹפֵר דִּבְרֵי מִצְות-יְהוָה, וְחֻקָּיו--עַל-יִשְׂרָאֵל. | Now this is the copy of the letter that the king Artaxerxes gave unto Ezra the priest, the scribe, even the scribe of the words of the commandments of the LORD, and of His statutes to Israel: | בְּנֵי-פַחַת מוֹאָב לִבְנֵי יֵשׁוּעַ, וְיוֹאָב--אַלְפַּיִם, וּשְׁמֹנֶה מֵאוֹת שְׁמֹנָה עָשָׂר. | The children of Pahath-moab, of the children of Jeshua and Joab, two thousand and eight hundred and eighteen.{S}

text_he: ארתחשסתא--מלך מלכיא לעזרא כהנא ספר דתא די-אלה שמיא גמיר--וכענת | 'Artaxerxes king of kings unto Ezra the priest the scribe of the Law of the God of heaven and so forth And now | בני עילם--אלף מאתים חמשים וארבעה | The children of Elam a thousand two hundred fifty and four{S}
text_en: 'Artaxerxes, king of kings, unto Ezra the priest, the scribe of the Law of the God of heaven, and so forth. And now
text_pisuk: אַרְתַּחְשַׁסְתְּא--מֶלֶךְ, מַלְכַיָּא: לְעֶזְרָא כָהֲנָא סָפַר דָּתָא דִּי-אֱלָהּ שְׁמַיָּא, גְּמִיר--וּכְעֶנֶת. | 'Artaxerxes, king of kings, unto Ezra the priest, the scribe of the Law of the God of heaven, and so forth. And now | בְּנֵי עֵילָם--אֶלֶף, מָאתַיִם חֲמִשִּׁים וְאַרְבָּעָה. | The children of Elam, a thousand two hundred fifty and four.{S}
